poem:
**Inauguration Reimagined**

He arrives, a phoenix from smoke,  
capitol crowned, promises strewn  
like confetti, unsettled skies stir  
their murmurs. Proclaiming  
new dawns, old echoes cling,  
words etched on executive scrolls—  
chaos painted gold.  
In fervent fever, nations pause,  
quicksilver hopes hung  
upon a gilded thread,  
history trembles, impatient  
for what will be unspun.
